page.title: 09FARMING IN NORTH FAREHAM
page.content: The average farm size is 200ha.The major type of agriculture is mixed farming.The farms grow the following crops in a four year rotation;barley and wheat(both winter and spring varieties),oats,mixed cereals;grass (for hay,silage and pasture);rape;potatoes and peas.Most farms have a herd of,on average,80 Friesian cattle and fatten calves and heifers for sale.The milk is sent by road tanker to Portsmouth.There is a significant amount of horticulture in the form of smallholdings growing cabbages,lettuce,rhubarb and tomatoes under glass.These are sold through the Hampshire growers co-operative to local markets.Most of the farmers are tenants of the Southwick Estates.
